intro: Swartzia picramnioides, commonly known as the purple-leafed ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, hard wood and striking purple foliage, which becomes more intense during the dry season. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family and is known for its compound leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry forest and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
